metadata.name: Azure Virtual Network Device Modified or Deleted
metadata.comment: Identifies when a virtual network device is being modified or deleted. This can be a network interface, network virtual appliance, virtual hub, or virtual router.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM entity_management WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 3 AND (lower(LOWER(api.operation)) in ('microsoft\\.network/networkinterfaces/tapconfigurations/write', 'microsoft\\.network/networkinterfaces/tapconfigurations/delete', 'microsoft\\.network/networkinterfaces/write', 'microsoft\\.network/networkinterfaces/join/action', 'microsoft\\.network/networkinterfaces/delete', 'microsoft\\.network/networkvirtualappliances/delete', 'microsoft\\.network/networkvirtualappliances/write', 'microsoft\\.network/virtualhubs/delete', 'microsoft\\.network/virtualhubs/write', 'microsoft\\.network/virtualrouters/write', 'microsoft\\.network/virtualrouters/delete')))

output.summary: Identifies when a virtual network device is being modified or deleted. This can be a network interface, network virtual appliance, virtual hub, or virtual router.

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Virtual Network Device being modified or deleted may be performed by a system administrator. Verify whether the user identity, user agent, and/or hostname should be making changes in your environment. 2. Virtual Network Device modified or deleted from unfamiliar users should be investigated. If known behavior is causing false positives, it can be exempted from the rule. Reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/role-based-access-control/resource-provider-operations
